title: Harmless Christmas ditty or creepy ode to harassment? The story of Baby, It’s Cold Outside
text:
Hey, what’s in this drink? As Baby, It’s Cold Outside gets a woke re-imagining, Alice Vincent explains how it wasn't always as bad as it seems

Baby, It’s Cold Outside has become part of the festive lexicon. The song’s title has transformed into a phrase built into advertising campaigns and Christmas cards. At 74 years old, it’s become a Christmas standard, covered endlessly and added to countless compilations. For Yuletide 2019, it’s being overhauled completely: John Legend and co-writer Natasha Rothwell have re-written the lyrics for a post-#MeToo Christmas, including the line “It’s your body, and your choice”.

The song's story is simple: a man and a woman have spent a pleasant evening together,...
